publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-4096 Mary Scanlon: Brain Injury Awareness Week: 13 to 19 March 2006â€”That the Parliament notes that brain injury is the biggest cause of death and disability amongst young people; recognises the shortage of specialist care and rehabilitation facilities in Scotland; supports the efforts by Headway, the brain injury association, to provide a range of services in the community to brain injury survivors and their carers, and calls on the Scottish Executive to acknowledge the extent of the problem and ensure that adequate resources are made available.

S2M-4096 Brain Injury Awareness Week: 13 to 19 March 2006 (lodged on 10 March 2006) Donald Gorrie*, Mr David Davidson*, Patrick Harvie*, Bruce Crawford*, Murray Tosh*, Christine Grahame*, Chris Ballance*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Murdo Fraser*, Alex Fergusson*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Rob Gibson*, Fiona Hyslop*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Shiona Baird*

S2M-4096 Brain Injury Awareness Week: 13 to 19 March 2006 (lodged on 10 March 2006) Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Mike Rumbles*, Robin Harper*, Margaret Mitchell*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Phil Gallie*, Richard Lochhead*, Eleanor Scott*
S2M-4096 Brain Injury Awareness Week: 13 to 19 March 2006 (lodged on 10 March 2006) Mrs Nanette Milne*, Tommy Sheridan*, Bill Aitken*, John Scott*
S2M-4096 Brain Injury Awareness Week: 13 to 19 March 2006 (lodged on 10 March 2006) Brian Adam*, Frances Curran*, Rosie Kane*
S2M-4096 Brain Injury Awareness Week: 13 to 19 March 2006 (lodged on 10 March 2006) Dr Jean Turner*
